J.D. and Randy,

It was great to get everyone on the phone this evening. A few follow up items:

1.  Do not underestimate Shift4's desire to drag us through the mud through the media and through
    litigation with the primary goal of scaring us into submission. They are not rational actors.

2.  I plan on sending an email to all of CardConnect employees before 8am tomorrow morning, letting them
    know that there may be some issues with commissions but assuring them that it is CardConnect's
    intention to resolve these issues as quickly as possible. I have no idea if the text of this email will
    make it back to shift4, and if so, I would like it to be on our terms. My concern is that, if they call
    employees, etc and ask them questions, I don't want the employees to provide them with any answers.
    My draft is below. Jeff or Sam - would you please let me know if are ok with the wording, etc?
    Everyone else is on the call, please weigh in as well.
    ... [Remaining text of email draft and original email ommited but does not reference "blow", focused on employee commissions]...

Don't forget to mention that all commissions will of course be paid. That is their nuclear bomb. We
need to take it off the table. If you assure them we will be auditng and they will be getting paid
what they are owed, the blow by calling the media is much less of an issue.

JDO

Subject: Talking Points

J.D. and Randy,

It was great to get everyone on the phone this evening. A few follow up items:

1.  Do not underestimate Shift4's desire to drag us through the mud through the media and through
    litigation with the primary goal of scaring us into submission. They are not rational actors.

2.  I plan on sending an email to all of CardConnect employees before 8am tomorrow morning, letting them
    know that there may be some issues with commissions but assuring them that it is CardConnect's
    intention to resolve these issues as quickly as possible. I have no idea if the text of this email will
    make it back to shift4, and if so, I would like it to be on our terms. My concern is that, if they call
    employees, etc and ask them questions, I don't want the employees to provide them with any answers.
    My draft is below. Jeff or Sam - would you please let me know if are ok with the wording, etc?
    Everyone else is on the call, please weigh in as well.
        ...[the rest of the email is omited]...
